snippet: When a bill to ban genetically engineered crops on the island of Hawaii was introduced, doubts nagged at Greggor Ilagan, a councilman, about what the risks were, if any, of the crops.
abstract: Debate over proposed bill to ban genetically engineered crops on the island of Hawaii highlights how popular beliefs on the subject often do not reflect scientific evidence; scientists, who have come to rely on liberals in political battles over other fields of research, have been dismayed to find themselves at odds with their traditional allies on the issue.
lead_paragraph: When a bill to ban genetically engineered crops on the island of Hawaii was introduced, doubts nagged at Greggor Ilagan, a councilman, about what the risks were, if any, of the crops.

headline.main: A Lonely Quest for Facts on Genetically Modified Crops
headline.print_headline: On Hawaii, a Lonely Quest for Fact
